content.raw:
*How should I use the test framework to check for when Gazebo crashes? Should I have try/catch statements in the test my test and fail the test in catch statements (since it means an exception went through)?*

If the software crashes due to an exception, maybe we can use here the `ASSERT_NO_THROW` from gtest.

*Should this be an InsertModelWidget unit test or should it be an integration test?*

Strictly speaking in terms of testing, that would fit better as an integration (several subsystems are being tested at the same time) than as a unit. To build a unit test we should make a non trivial work of mock and stubs. I also tend to consider that all testing which involves the X subsystem fall under a different category and not unit tests. Definitions on unit testing usually include the need of being run fast.

*Not really a question, more of a statement: I can easily change the permissions of a file using Boost, though it looks like I can't change the owner, so that case will not be taken care of.*

I would not expect gazebo (or any other software) to touch any of permission unless it explicitly warn me about that.
